title: Combined Effect of Temperature and DO

content.question: Significant increases in water temperature can drastically change dissolved oxygen <math alttext="D O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>DO</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> levels in a lake. Why does the combined effect of these two environmental changes result in algal blooms?

choices.label: Low dissolved oxygen leads to death for aerobic organisms, like fish, whose decomposition provides an overabundance of nutrients for the algae, resulting in the large blooms.

Increased temperature causes an increase in metabolic rates of fish and insects. Increased metabolism results in increased waste from aquatic organisms, which provides energy for the algae to grow rapidly.
Increased temperature and low dissolved oxygen drive aquatic animals out of the area. The lack of competition gives the algae more nutrients for reproduction.
Increased temperature leads to an increase in dissolved oxygen. The higher oxygen content increases the rates of cellular respiration and reproduction, resulting in an increased population of algae.

content.answer: Low dissolved oxygen leads to death for aerobic organisms, like fish, whose decomposition provides an overabundance of nutrients for the algae, resulting in the large blooms.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain environmental concepts, processes, or models in applied contexts.
